# init(forOfflineGPUAtIndex:colorSpace:options:sharedContext:)

**Initializer**

Creates an OpenGL-based Core Image context using a GPU that is not currently driving a display, with the specified options.

## Declaration

```swift
init?(forOfflineGPUAtIndex index: UInt32, colorSpace: CGColorSpace?, options: [CIContextOption : Any]? = nil, sharedContext: CGLContextObj?)
```

```swift
init?(forOfflineGPUAt index: UInt32, colorSpace: CGColorSpace?, options: [CIContextOption : Any]? = nil, sharedContext: CGLContextObj?)
```

## Parameters

- **index**: The index of the offline GPU with which to create the context; a number between zero and the value returned by the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIContext/offlineGPUCount()] method.
- **colorSpace**: A color space object encapsulating color space information that is used to specify how color values are interpreted.
- **options**: A dictionary that contains options for creating a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIContext] object. You can pass any of the keys defined in `Context Options` along with the appropriate value.
- **sharedContext**: A CGL context with which to share OpenGL resources, obtained by calling the CGL function `CGLCreateContext(_:_:_:)`. Pass `NULL` to use a context that does not share OpenGL resources.

## Return Value

A Core Image context.

## Discussion

GPU devices that are not currently being used to drive a display can be used for Core Image rendering. Use the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIContext/offlineGPUCount()] method to determine whether any such GPUs are available.

To create a Metal-based Core Image context using an offline GPU, use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLCopyAllDevices()] function to list Metal devices, then choose a device without a display to pass to the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIContext/init(mtlDevice:)] method.
